info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 1:14PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: As temperatures rise into the 80s through mid-week, area rivers and streams are forecast to rise to bankfull conditions from rapid snowmelt in higher elevations through at least Wednesday. For the Taiya River, hikers on the lower portion of the Chilkoot Trail should note that portions of the Chilkoot Trail could begin to inundate with water. For the Chilkat River, areas around mile post 14 and 16 of the Haines Highway are the most likely places to experience minor flooding. This SPS replaces the Flood Advisory that was in effect. The hottest days are forecast to be on Monday and Tuesday when temperatures will rise well into the 80s. Records are possible. To minimize impacts of the heat wave, locate fans for cooling; wear light-colored and loose fitting clothes when outdoors; drink plenty of fluids, apply sun protection, and take breaks if you must be outdoors for extended periods; do not leave young children and pets unattended in closed vehicles; and plan to check on the elderly, those who are home-bound, and other loved ones and neighbors who could be more vulnerable. This weather pattern has been known to favor the possibility of thunderstorms during late afternoons and evenings and that potential will continue to be monitored. For Chilkat River at Klukwan: At 12:00pm the stage was 126.42 feet. Flood Stage is 128.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 126.8 feet is expected around 10:00am Tuesday. For Taiya River near Skagway: At 12:00pm the stage was 15.76 feet. Flood Stage is 16.5 feet. Forecast: A crest around 16.2 feet is expected around 10:00pm Tuesday.
